CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 27, 1957, pg. 27 reads: "Inspect New Rubbish Trucks - City officials are shown above at ceremonies on July 22, near the incinerator plant on 29th St., inspecting 24 new "Load-packing trucks" before they were placed in service late this week. These new trucks have special bodies with mechanical devices to compress rubbish and garbage into compact loads.  Loading is done at the back ,from the ground, and eliminates ladder-climbing to discard the refuse.  Left to right: James S. Devlin, director of Public Works; Councilman Paul F. Jones, Mayor David L. Lawrence, Councilman Patrick D. Fagan, James J. Hughes, superintendent of refuse collection; Councilman Bennett Rogers, Councilman Charles F. Dinan, Theodore Johnson, president, Local 609, and Councilman David Olbum. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of city officials, from left: James S. Devlin, Paul F. Jones, Mayor David L. Lawrence, Patrick D. Fagan, James J. Hughes, Bennett Rogers, Charles F. Dinan, Theodore Johnson, and Councilman David Olbum, gathered in front of a Heil Colectomatic garbage truck
